013package org.apache.juneau.objecttools;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StateMachineState.*;
016
017import java.util.*;
018
019import org.apache.juneau.*;
020import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
021
022/**
023 * Number matcher factory for the {@link ObjectSearcher} class.
024 *
025 * <p>
026 *    The class provides searching based on the following patterns:
027 * </p>
028 * <ul>
029 *    <li><js>"property=1"</js> - A single number
030 *    <li><js>"property=1 2"</js> - Multiple OR'ed numbers
031 *    <li><js>"property=-1 -2"</js> - Multiple OR'ed negative numbers
032 *    <li><js>"property=1-2"</js>,<js>"property=-2--1"</js>  - A range of numbers (whitespace ignored)
033 *    <li><js>"property=1-2 4-5"</js> - Multiple OR'ed ranges
034 *    <li><js>"property=&lt;1"</js>,<js>"property=&lt;=1"</js>,<js>"property=&gt;1"</js>,<js>"property=&gt;=1"</js> - Open-ended ranges
035 *    <li><js>"property=!1"</js>,<js>"property=!1-2"</js> - Negation
036 * </ul>
037 *
038 * <ul class='seealso'>
039 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.ObjectTools">Overview &gt; juneau-marshall &gt; Object Tools</a>
040 * </ul>
041 */
042public class NumberMatcherFactory extends MatcherFactory {
043
044   /**
045    * Default reusable matcher.
046    */
047   public static final NumberMatcherFactory DEFAULT = new NumberMatcherFactory();
048
049   @Override
050   public boolean canMatch(ClassMeta<?> cm) {
051      return cm.isNumber();
052   }
053
054   @Override
055   public AbstractMatcher create(String pattern) {
056      return new NumberMatcher(pattern);
057   }
058
059   /**
060    * A construct representing a single search pattern.
061    */
062   private static class NumberMatcher extends AbstractMatcher {
063      NumberRange[] numberRanges;
064      String pattern;
065      private static final AsciiSet
066         SNUM = AsciiSet.create("-0123456789."),
067         NUM = AsciiSet.create("0123456789."),
068         WS = AsciiSet.create(" \t");
069
070      public NumberMatcher(String s) {
071
072         s = s.trim();
073         pattern = s;
074
075         List<NumberRange> l = new LinkedList<>();
076
077         // Possible patterns:
078         // 123, >123, <123, >=123, <=123, >-123, >=-123, 123-456, -123--456, !123, !123-456, 123 - 456 (one token), 123 -456 (two separate tokens)
079
080         // Possible states:
081         // S01 = Looking for start (WS=S01, [!]=S01, [>]=S02, [<]=S03, SNUM=S06)
082         // S02 = Found [>], looking for [=]/SNUM ([=]=S04, WS=S05, SNUM=S06)
083         // S03 = Found [<], looking for [=]/SNUM ([=]=S05, WS=S05, SNUM=S06)
084         // S04 = Found [=], looking for SNUN (WS=S05, SNUM=S06)
085         // S05 = Found [... ], looking for SNUM (SNUM=S06)
086         // S06 = Found [1], looking for [-]/WS (WS=S07, [-]=S08)
087         // S07 = Found [123 ], looking for [-]/SNUM (if -, could be 123 - 456 or 123 -456) ([-]=S09, SNUM=S07)
088         // S08 = Found [123-], looking for SNUM (Could be 123- 456 or 123-456) (SNUM=S11)
089         // S09 = Found [123 -], looking for WS/SNUM (If WS, then it's 123 - 456, otherwise 123 -456) (WS=S10, SNUM=S06)
090         // S10 = Found [123 - ], looking for SNUM (SNUM=S12)
091         // S11 = Found [123 - 4], looking for WS (WS=S01)
092
093         StateMachineState state = S01;
094         int mark = 0;
095         boolean isNot = false;
096         Equality eq = Equality.NONE;
097         Integer n1 = null, n2 = null;
098
099         int i;
100         for (i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
101            char c = s.charAt(i);
102            if (state == S01) {
103               if (c == '!') {
104                  isNot = true;
105               } else if (WS.contains(c)) {
106                  state = S01;
107               } else if (c == '>') {
108                  state = S02;
109                  eq = Equality.GT;
110               } else if (c == '<') {
111                  state = S03;
112                  eq = Equality.LT;
113               } else if (SNUM.contains(c)) {
114                  state = S06;
115                  mark = i;
116               } else {
117                  break;
118               }
119            } else if (state == S02) {
120               if (c == '=') {
121                  state = S04;
122                  eq = Equality.GTE;
123               } else if (WS.contains(c)) {
124                  state = S05;
125               } else if (SNUM.contains(c)) {
126                  state = S06;
127                  mark = i;
128               } else {
129                  break;
130               }
131            } else if (state == S03) {
132               if (c == '=') {
133                  state = S04;
134                  eq = Equality.LTE;
135               } else if (WS.contains(c)) {
136                  state = S05;
137               } else if (SNUM.contains(c)) {
138                  state = S06;
139                  mark = i;
140               } else {
141                  break;
142               }
143            } else if (state == S04) {
144               if (WS.contains(c)) {
145                  state = S05;
146               } else if (SNUM.contains(c)) {
147                  mark = i;
148                  state = S06;
149               } else {
150                  break;
151               }
152            } else if (state == S05) {
153               if (WS.contains(c)) {
154                  state = S05;
155               } else if (SNUM.contains(c)) {
156                  state = S06;
157                  mark = i;
158               } else {
159                  break;
160               }
161            } else if (state == S06) {
162               if (NUM.contains(c)) {
163                  state = S06;
164               } else if (WS.contains(c)) {
165                  state = S07;
166                  n1 = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(mark, i));
167               } else if (c == '-') {
168                  state = S08;
169                  n1 = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(mark, i));
170               } else {
171                  break;
172               }
173            } else if (state == S07) {
174               if (WS.contains(c)) {
175                  state = S07;
176               } else if (c == '-') {
177                  state = S09;
178               } else if (SNUM.contains(c)) {
179                  state = S06;
180                  l.add(new NumberRange(eq, n1, isNot));
181                  eq = Equality.NONE;
182                  n1 = null;
183                  isNot = false;
184                  mark = i;
185               } else {
186                  break;
187               }
188            } else if (state == S08) {
189               if (WS.contains(c)) {
190                  state = S08;
191               } else if (SNUM.contains(c)) {
192                  state = S11;
193                  mark = i;
194               } else {
195                  break;
196               }
197            } else if (state == S09)  {
198               if (WS.contains(c)) {
199                  state = S10;
200               } else if (NUM.contains(c)) {
201                  state = S06;
202                  l.add(new NumberRange(eq, n1, isNot));
203                  eq = Equality.NONE;
204                  n1 = null;
205                  isNot = false;
206                  mark = i-1;
207               } else {
208                  break;
209               }
210            } else if (state == S10) {
211               if (WS.contains(c)) {
212                  state = S10;
213               } else if (SNUM.contains(c)) {
214                  state = S11;
215                  mark = i;
216               } else {
217                  break;
218               }
219            } else /* (state == S11) */ {
220               if (SNUM.contains(c)) {
221                  state = S11;
222               } else if (WS.contains(c)) {
223                  state = S01;
224                  n2 = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(mark, i));
225                  l.add(new NumberRange(eq, n1, n2, isNot));
226                  eq = Equality.NONE;
227                  n1 = n2 = null;
228                  isNot = false;
229               } else {
230                  break;
231               }
232            }
233         }
234
235         if (i != s.length())
236            throw new PatternException("Invalid range pattern ({0}): {1}", state, s);
237
238         if (state == S01) {
239            // No tokens found.
240         } else if (state == S02 || state == S03 || state == S04 || state == S08 || state == S09) {
241            throw new PatternException("Invalid range pattern (E{0}): {1}", state, s);
242         } else if (state == S06) {
243            n1 = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(mark).trim());
244            l.add(new NumberRange(eq, n1, isNot));
245         } else /* (state == S11) */ {
246            n2 = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(mark).trim());
247            l.add(new NumberRange(eq, n1, n2, isNot));
248         }
249
250         numberRanges = l.toArray(new NumberRange[l.size()]);
251      }
252
253      @Override /* Matcher */
254      public boolean matches(ClassMeta<?> cm, Object o) {
255         Number n = (Number)o;
256         if (numberRanges.length == 0)
257            return true;
258         for (int i = 0; i < numberRanges.length; i++)
259            if (numberRanges[i].matches(n))
260               return true;
261         return false;
262      }
263
264      @Override /* Object */
265      public String toString() {
266         return pattern;
267      }
268   }
269
270   /**
271    * A construct representing a single search range in a single search pattern.
272    * All possible forms of search patterns are boiled down to these number ranges.
273    */
274   private static class NumberRange {
275      int start;
276      int end;
277      boolean isNot;
278
279      public NumberRange(Equality eq, Integer num, boolean isNot) {
280         this(eq, num, null, isNot);
281      }
282
283      public NumberRange(Equality eq, Integer start, Integer end, boolean isNot) {
284         this.isNot = isNot;
285
286         // 123, >123, <123, >=123, <=123, >-123, >=-123, 123-456, -123--456
287         if (eq == Equality.NONE && end == null) { // 123
288            this.start = start;
289            this.end = this.start;
290         } else if (eq == Equality.GT) {
291            this.start = start+1;
292            this.end = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
293         } else if (eq == Equality.GTE) {
294            this.start = start;
295            this.end = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
296         } else if (eq == Equality.LT) {
297            this.start = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
298            this.end = start-1;
299         } else if (eq == Equality.LTE) {
300            this.start = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
301            this.end = start;
302         } else {
303            this.start = start;
304            this.end = end;
305         }
306      }
307
308      public boolean matches(Number n) {
309         long i = n.longValue();
310         boolean b = (i>=start && i<=end);
311         if (isNot)
312            b = !b;
313         return b;
314      }
315   }
316}
